kineticstoolkit.dbinterface module¶

Provide the DBInterface class.

Classes

DBInterface(project_label[, user, password, …])

Interface for Felix Chenier’s BIOMEC database.
class kineticstoolkit.dbinterface.DBInterface(project_label, user='', password='', root_folder='', url='https://felixchenier.uqam.ca/biomec')¶

Bases: object

Interface for Felix Chenier’s BIOMEC database.

Parameters

  • project_label (str) – Project label, for example ‘FC_XX16E’.

  • user (str) – Optional. Username on BIOMEC. If none is supplied, a dialog box asks the user for his/her credentials.

  • password (str) – Optional. Password on BIOMEC.

  • root_folder (str) – Optional. Project’s root folder, where all data files are stored. If none is given, a dialog box asks the user to point to this folder.

  • url (str) – Optional. BIOMEC’s url.

Methods

batch_fix_file_type(folder, new_file_type_label, create_file_entries=False, dry_run=True)¶

Batch-rename files in a folder to their new corresponding dbfid.

Warning

The function batch_fix_file_type is unstable, which means it may not be tested or settled yet. Please avoid using this function in production code.

This function is helpful to quickly assign new dbfids to a batch of processed file based on files that are already referenced in the database.

As a practical example, let’s say we have a folder full of raw kinematics take files, and we batch-export those files to a new folder of c3d files. Both the raw take files and the c3d files share the same name, apart from the extension.

Now, let say a project contains these filetypes:

  • ‘RawKinematics’: raw kinematic take files;

  • ‘LabelledKinematics’: c3d files with labelled markers.

If the raw kinematics files were correctly assigned to database entries before batch-exporting, then the exported c3d files contain the original (incorrect) dbfid entry in their file names.

This function changes the file names of the exported files so that they match their correct entry in the database.

Parameters

  • folder (str) – Folder that contains the set of files to rename. These files must have the original dbfid in their name, to identify the trial they belong to.

  • new_file_type_label (str) – FileTypeLabel as set in the database. For example: ‘LabelledKinematics’.

  • create_file_entries (bool) – Optional. When True and if a file entry for the specified file type ID does not exist in the found trial, create the file entry in the database, then rename the file accordingly.

  • dry_run (bool) – Optional. When True, the list of file renames is returned, but no action is actually taken.

Returns

A dictionary with the following keys:

  • ’Rename’ : list of tuples (old_file_name, new_file_name).

  • ’Ignore’ : list of files without a dbfid.

  • ’NoFileTypeLabel’ : list of files which associated trial does not contain the specified FileTypeLabel

Return type

Dict[str, List[Any]]

create_file_entry(trial_id, file_type_label)¶

Create a file entry in the database.

Warning

The function create_file_entry is unstable, which means it may not be tested or settled yet. Please avoid using this function in production code.

The project’s tables are updated after adding the file entry.

Parameters

  • trial_id (int) – Trial identifier in the database. Can be obtained using get(participant, session, trial)[‘TrialID’].

  • file_type_label (str) – File type label.

Return type

None

property files¶

Return a list of all file labels in the project.

Return type

List[str]

get(participant='', session='', trial='', file='')¶

Extract information from a project.

Warning

The function get is unstable, which means it may not be tested or settled yet. Please avoid using this function in production code.

Parameters

  • participant (str) – Optional. Participant label (for example, ‘P01’).

  • session (str) – Optional. Session label (for example, ‘SB4320’).

  • trial (str) – Optional. Trial label (for example, ‘Static’).

  • file (str) – Optional. File label (for example, ‘Kinematics’).

Note

A former parameter could not be empty while a latter parameters is not. For example, participant could not be ‘’ if session is ‘SB4320’.

Returns

A record of the specified information.

Return type

Dict[str, Any]

load(participant, session, trial, file)¶

Load a variable from a BIOMEC referenced file.

Warning

The function load is unstable, which means it may not be tested or settled yet. Please avoid using this function in production code.

This method load the ktk.zip file associated to a participant, session, trial and file type.

Parameters

  • participant (str) – Participant label. For example, ‘P01’

  • session (str) – Session label. For example, ‘SB4320’

  • trial (str) – Trial label. For example, ‘StaticR1’

  • file (str) – File type label. For example, ‘SyncedMarkers’

Returns

The file’s content.

Return type

Any

property participants¶

Return a list of all participant labels in the project.

Return type

List[str]

Warning

rename(filename, dbfid)¶

Rename a file to include or modify a dbfid code in its filename.

Warning

The function rename is unstable, which means it may not be tested or settled yet. Please avoid using this function in production code.

Parameters

  • filename (str) – Name of the file to rename

  • dbfid (int) – FileID in database

Return type

None

save(participant, session, trial, file, variable)¶

Save a variable to a BIOMEC referenced file.

Warning

The function save is unstable, which means it may not be tested or settled yet. Please avoid using this function in production code.

This method saves the specified variable following either of these cases:

  • If the participant, session, trial and file labels are already associated to a file on disk, the file is overwritten.

  • If the participant, session, trial and file labels are associated to a file entry but no file exists on disk, the file is created and saved in root_folder/file_label/participant/session as dbfidxxxxn_{trial}.ktk.zip.

  • If the participant, session, trial and file labels do not correspond to a file entry in the database, a file entry is created in the database, then the file is saved as in 2nd case.

Parameters

  • participant (str) – Participant label. For example, ‘P01’

  • session (str) – Session label. For example, ‘SB4320’

  • trial (str) – Trial label. For example, ‘StaticR1’

  • file (str) – File type label. For example, ‘SyncedMarkers’

  • variable (Any) – Any variable that is supported by ktk.save

Returns

The file path

Return type

str

property sessions¶

Return a list of all session labels in the project.

Return type

List[str]

tag_files(include_trial_name=True, dry_run=True)¶

Rename all files to include tags in file names.

Warning

The function tag_files is unstable, which means it may not be tested or settled yet. Please avoid using this function in production code.

This method renames all the files referenced by the project following the given specifications. The resulting file can be either:

  • ORIGINALNAME_dbfidXXXXn.EXT

  • ORIGINALNAME_dbfidXXXXn_{TRIALNAME}.EXT

Parameters

  • include_trial_name (bool) – Optional. True to include the trial name from the file name.

  • dry_run (bool) – Optional. Set to False to actually perform the rename.

Return type

None

property trials¶

Return a list of all trial labels in the project.

Return type

List[str]
